page.title: 09THE JAMEA MOSQUE, PRESTON
page.content: In 1967 the{Muslim}community in Frenchwood bought an old vicarage in Clarendon Street and converted it into a Mosque.The number of Muslims grew so two adjoining houses were purchased. These buildings have a small prayer hall and classrooms. Children go after school to study the Koran. About 500 people go to the{Mosque}every week. Friday is the busiest day. The Muslim community decided in the late 1970's that a{new"Masjid"}was needed. Every Muslim family in French -wood donated money and fund raisers went to Canada,Saudi Arabia,Zambia and S.Africa.Â£183,000 was donated.The foun -dation stone was laid in July '83.The Mosque will be finished by late 1985. The new Prayer Hall will hold 500 people.There will be rooms for women, and also a Community Centre and Youth Club.
